intro: Mecosorus trilobus, commonly known as the three-lobed fern, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its distinctive, trifoliate leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in an inflorescence called a spadix, which is enclosed by a modified leaf called a spathe. Mecosorus trilobus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptability make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
